definition: sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole
Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]

sentences.english: Take a sad song and make it better.
sentences.chinese: 找一首哀伤的歌，把它唱得更快乐。

sentences.english: The voice of the mournful chanter called to dolorous prayer.
sentences.chinese: 哀恸的领唱人的声音向哀伤的祷告者呼唤。

sentences.english: Grief and despair fill my heart.
sentences.chinese: 哀伤与苦闷充满我的心。

sentences.english: I want you to be happy, not sad.
sentences.chinese: 我要你快乐趑趄不前，不要哀伤。

sentences.english: The high priest Eli was terribly distressed to see the Ark of Covenant taken from the Holy of Holies.
sentences.chinese: 以利王哀伤的看着神的约柜被搬出神殿。

sentences.english: In her grief, Elizabeth was comforted by a 16)stalwart monk called Markus.
sentences.chinese: 这时，诚笃的僧侣马库斯安慰哀伤的伊丽莎白。

sentences.english: He raised his mournful eyes towards the deep blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 他满眼哀伤，仰望着深兰色的天空。

sentences.english: She is disconsolate at the death of her cat.
The solitude crossed with dream and with silence. Penned up between the sea and sadness.
sentences.chinese: 孤寂借梦和沉默穿过，在海与哀伤之间被囚禁。

sentences.english: Still, the sheer enormity of the disaster is transcending the grievances of the past.
sentences.chinese: 然而，无比巨大的灾难还是超越了过去历史的哀伤。

sentences.english: Leaning into the afternoons I cast mky sad nets towards your oceanic eyes.
sentences.chinese: 倚身暮色里，我朝悄海洋般的双眼，投掷我哀伤的网。

sentences.english: Lest one touch of this heart convey its grief.
sentences.chinese: 生怕心触及，哀伤现无遗。

sentences.english: The singers' plaintive squeals form the soundtrack of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 那些京剧演员哀伤的唱腔成了我们生活的配乐。

sentences.english: Melancholy is thus the most legitimate of all poetic tones.
sentences.chinese: 因此哀伤成了所有诗歌腔调的最合理的。

sentences.english: Jo often stared at Meg with sad eyes.
sentences.chinese: 乔常以哀伤的眼神对著梅格凝视。

sentences.english: Listening to sad songs, happy to see the show.
sentences.chinese: 听哀伤的歌，看幸福的戏。
